data.text: @bell00david Same thing happened in alberta with 2 dose most likely to be infected at population rate compared to unvaccinated. Now 3 dose leads the pack.

@bell00david There's a theory that one group is less likely to get tested, though I'm not sure if an actual analysis has been done on that

With regards to mortality I'm wary it might (again) be another statistical quirk - eg @profnfenton's theory, or people simply too sick to risk taking it

@_Kodos_ Interesting to speculate why. Inhibition of natural immunity?   They still appear to reduce Covid mortality (cf. all-cause) which suggests some immunity may be better than none in highly-susceptible. (Though total numbers are low)
@bell00david Judging from the reduced numbers of following/followers who get to see, then: who's suppressing?

@bell00david SOME humans have memories. The rest just rely on periodic state conditioning which is WHY it is imperative to force the facts down their throats & dislodge their blissful Pavlovian state of mind. They must be reminded of WHAT they were promised so hopefully understand the LIE. https://t.co/aR8KhLqvzo
@bell00david Question: what's INSIDE the Injection? Publicly documented, known but who's NOTICING?
@bell00david Interestingly the difference only became apparent during the winter spike. Before that there wasn't much difference between them https://t.co/04zCUgZEzO
